result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah M Lytle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur to each other, 21CM1800, 21CM2234 and 22CF393.
Concurrent with: each other, 21CM1800, 21CM2234 and 22CF393

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward CL. Ban from CL's residence unless approved by agent. Ban from grounds and surrounding streets of East High School in Madison, WI. Not use/possess alcohol.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if def successfully completes probation including all financial obligations and no new referrals.

Comply with mental health treatment.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
7/12/22 CT orders condition of probation "Defendant must immediately seek mental health treatment at DC3 or Tellurian and comply with all treatment recommendations."
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/12/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

09:36 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 
  Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to ct 2, 21CM1800, 21CM2234, 22CF393 

COUNT #   2
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to ct 1, 21CM1800, 21CM2234, 22CF393 

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription 
-No threats/acts of violence against: Christopher L
-Ban: Christopher L's residence unless approved by agent
-Ban: Grounds and surrounding streets of East High School in Madison, WI
-Not use/possess alcohol
-Comply w/ mental health treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-Provide DNA sample
-Defendant not to use or possess any weapon 
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 if Defn successfully completes probation, including all financial obligations and no new referrals
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1, 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit if revoked: 26

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC

Casee T
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:52 AM Defendant not in court, in custody with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests plea/sentencing, address verified.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

11:23 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Paul Fredrickson for Tracey J Lencioni.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Dep Miranda except only as necessary for professional purposes. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:51 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
